name: Palantir
explanation: Palantir is a seeing-stone used by Sauron and others in Middle-earth, and also a US data analytics company founded in 2003.

name: Mithril
explanation: Mithril is the precious silver metal in Middle-earth, and also Meta's open-source AI model series.

name: Shadowfax
explanation: Shadowfax is the lord of all horses in Middle-earth, ridden by Gandalf.

name: Zoloft
explanation: Zoloft (sertraline) is one of the most commonly prescribed SSRI antidepressants.

name: Lexapro
explanation: Lexapro (escitalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for anxiety and depression.

name: Snorlax
explanation: Snorlax is a Normal-type Pokémon known for sleeping and blocking paths.

name: Celebi
explanation: Celebi is a Psychic/Grass-type mythical Pokémon that can travel through time.

name: Anduril
explanation: Andúril is Aragorn's reforged sword 'Flame of the West', and also a US defense technology company founded by Palmer Luckey.

name: Silmaril
explanation: The Silmarils are three jewels created by Fëanor containing the light of the Two Trees of Valinor.

name: Prozac
explanation: Prozac (fluoxetine) was the first SSRI antidepressant, approved in 1987.

name: Geodude
explanation: Geodude is a Rock/Ground-type Pokémon that looks like a boulder with arms.

name: Arwen
explanation: Arwen Undómiel is the Elven princess who chose mortality to be with Aragorn.

name: Kafka
explanation: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform used for high-performance data pipelines.

name: Eevee
explanation: Eevee is a Normal-type Pokémon famous for its many possible evolutions.

name: Wellbutrin
explanation: Wellbutrin (bupropion) is an atypical antidepressant that works differently from SSRIs.

name: Terraform
explanation: Terraform is an infrastructure-as-code tool by HashiCorp for provisioning cloud resources.

name: Galadriel
explanation: Galadriel is the Lady of Lothlórien, one of the most powerful Elves in Middle-earth.

name: Cymbalta
explanation: Cymbalta (duloxetine) is an SNRI antidepressant also used for chronic pain.

name: Kubernetes
explanation: Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source container orchestration platform originally developed by Google.

name: Pikachu
explanation: Pikachu is the iconic Electric-type Pokémon and mascot of the franchise.

name: Númenor
explanation: Númenor was the great island kingdom of Men, destroyed when they tried to invade the Undying Lands.

name: Effexor
explanation: Effexor (venlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Grafana
explanation: Grafana is an open-source analytics and visualization platform for monitoring data.

name: Mewtwo
explanation: Mewtwo is a Psychic-type legendary Pokémon created through genetic engineering from Mew's DNA.

name: Ditto
explanation: Ditto is a Normal-type Pokémon that can transform into anything, AND it's a popular clipboard manager app for macOS.

name: Porygon
explanation: Porygon is the first artificial Pokémon, made entirely of programming code. Not to be confused with Polygon, the blockchain.

name: Polygon
explanation: Polygon is a Layer 2 blockchain scaling solution for Ethereum. Not the digital Pokémon, that's Porygon.

name: Celexa
explanation: Celexa (citalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant. Sounds like Celebi, but won't help you time travel.

name: Chansey
explanation: Chansey is a Normal-type Pokémon that carries a healing egg. Sounds like a medication, but it's just very caring.

name: Blissey
explanation: Blissey is Chansey's evolution, known for making people happy. Still not an antidepressant though.

name: Drowzee
explanation: Drowzee is a Psychic-type Pokémon that eats dreams. Sounds like a sleep aid, but definitely isn't FDA approved.

name: Hypno
explanation: Hypno is Drowzee's evolution that hypnotizes prey. Not a sedative, despite the name.

name: Electrode
explanation: Electrode is an Electric-type Pokémon that looks like a Poké Ball. Sounds techy, but will just explode on you.

name: Magneton
explanation: Magneton is three Magnemite linked together. Sounds like a physics term, but it's just magnets with eyes.

name: Rotom
explanation: Rotom is an Electric/Ghost Pokémon that possesses appliances. 'Motor' backwards - very tech-adjacent but still a Pokémon.

name: Heroku
explanation: Heroku is a cloud platform for deploying apps. Sounds like a Pokémon, but it's just a PaaS.

name: Roku
explanation: Roku is a streaming device company. Definitely sounds like it could be a Rock-type Pokémon.

name: Redis
explanation: Redis is an in-memory data structure store. Sounds like a medication, but it's just very fast key-value storage.

name: Istio
explanation: Istio is a service mesh for Kubernetes. Sounds pharmaceutical, but it's for managing microservices.

name: Paxil
explanation: Paxil (paroxetine) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Pristiq
explanation: Pristiq (desvenlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant, the active metabolite of Effexor.

name: Remeron
explanation: Remeron (mirtazapine) is a tetracyclic antidepressant that also helps with sleep.

name: Trintellix
explanation: Trintellix (vortioxetine) is a newer antidepressant with a multimodal mechanism of action.

name: Trazodone
explanation: Trazodone is an antidepressant often prescribed off-label for insomnia.

name: Abilify
explanation: Abilify (aripiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic often used to augment antidepressants.

name: Sauron
explanation: Sauron is the Dark Lord, creator of the One Ring, and main antagonist of Lord of the Rings.

name: Saruman
explanation: Saruman the White was the head of the wizard order who was corrupted by Sauron.

name: Legolas
explanation: Legolas is the Elven prince of Mirkwood and member of the Fellowship, known for his archery.

name: Gimli
explanation: Gimli is the Dwarf warrior of the Fellowship, son of Glóin, and friend of Legolas.

name: Elrond
explanation: Elrond Half-elven is the Lord of Rivendell who hosted the Council that formed the Fellowship.

name: Balrog
explanation: The Balrog is the ancient demon of shadow and flame that Gandalf faced in Moria.

name: Nazgûl
explanation: The Nazgûl are the nine Ringwraiths, Men corrupted by the Nine Rings of Power.

name: Glamdring
explanation: Glamdring is Gandalf's Elven sword, also known as 'Foe-hammer', found in a troll hoard.

name: Morgoth
explanation: Morgoth was the first Dark Lord, Sauron's master, and the original source of evil in Arda.

name: Shelob
explanation: Shelob is the giant spider who guards the pass of Cirith Ungol and attacked Frodo.

name: Prometheus
explanation: Prometheus is a Greek Titan who gave fire to humanity, AND an open-source monitoring system. Double trouble!

name: Loki
explanation: Loki is the Norse trickster god, AND a log aggregation system by Grafana Labs. Mischief managed both ways.

name: Helm
explanation: Helm is a package manager for Kubernetes. Sounds like fantasy equipment, but it's just YAML templates.

name: Vault
explanation: HashiCorp Vault is a secrets management tool. Sounds like a dungeon feature, manages passwords instead.

name: Consul
explanation: HashiCorp Consul is a service mesh solution. Sounds like a Roman official, does service discovery.

name: Nomad
explanation: HashiCorp Nomad is a workload orchestrator. Sounds adventurous, schedules containers.

name: Envoy
explanation: Envoy is a high-performance proxy for service mesh. Sounds like a diplomatic messenger, routes traffic.

name: Arceus
explanation: Arceus is the 'God Pokémon' said to have created the universe. Sounds like a medication or spell.

name: Dialga
explanation: Dialga is the legendary Pokémon that controls time. Sounds like it could be a blood pressure medication.

name: Palkia
explanation: Palkia is the legendary Pokémon that controls space. Definitely sounds like a medication.

name: Giratina
explanation: Giratina rules the Distortion World. Sounds like an antibiotic, is actually an antimatter dragon.

name: Luxray
explanation: Luxray is an Electric-type Pokémon with X-ray vision. Sounds like a medical imaging company.

name: Lucario
explanation: Lucario is a Fighting/Steel-type Pokémon that can sense aura. Sounds like a car brand or medication.

name: Audino
explanation: Audino is a Normal-type Pokémon that can sense feelings with its ears. Sounds like a hearing aid brand.

name: Latios
explanation: Latios is a Dragon/Psychic legendary Pokémon. Sounds like an operating system or medication.

name: Latias
explanation: Latias is Latios's counterpart. Also sounds like it could be a medication or software.

name: Solana
explanation: Solana is a high-performance blockchain. Sounds like it could be an antidepressant or a Pokémon.

name: Avalanche
explanation: Avalanche is a blockchain platform. Sounds like a Pokémon move, is actually crypto infrastructure.

name: Cardano
explanation: Cardano is a proof-of-stake blockchain named after mathematician Gerolamo Cardano.

name: Ansible
explanation: Ansible is an IT automation tool. Named after the instant communication device from sci-fi.

name: Datadog
explanation: Datadog is a monitoring and analytics platform. Not a Pokémon, despite the animal name.

name: Splunk
explanation: Splunk is a data analytics platform. Sounds like a Pokémon move or a weird medication.

name: Supabase
explanation: Supabase is an open-source Firebase alternative. Sounds like it could be a Pokémon base form.

name: Vercel
explanation: Vercel is a cloud platform for frontend deployment. Sounds vaguely pharmaceutical.

name: Netlify
explanation: Netlify is a web development platform. Sounds like a Pokémon ability.

name: Eowyn
explanation: Éowyn is the shieldmaiden of Rohan who slew the Witch-king with 'I am no man!'

name: Faramir
explanation: Faramir is Boromir's brother, Captain of Gondor, who showed quality by letting Frodo go.

name: Boromir
explanation: Boromir is the son of Denethor who was corrupted by the Ring but redeemed himself in death.

name: Isildur
explanation: Isildur cut the Ring from Sauron's hand but refused to destroy it, leading to ages of trouble.

name: Treebeard
explanation: Treebeard (Fangorn) is the oldest Ent, shepherd of the trees, who led the attack on Isengard.

name: Smeagol
explanation: Sméagol was a Hobbit-like creature corrupted into Gollum by the One Ring's influence.

name: Slowpoke
explanation: Slowpoke is a Water/Psychic-type Pokémon that takes 5 seconds to feel pain. Not a medication for slow thinking.

name: Abra
explanation: Abra is a Psychic-type Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day. Named after 'abracadabra', not a pill.

name: Kadabra
explanation: Kadabra evolves from Abra and has a silver spoon. Still part of a magic word, not a drug.

name: Alakazam
explanation: Alakazam has an IQ of 5,000 and two spoons. Completes the magic word trio, still not pharmaceutical.

name: Nidoran
explanation: Nidoran is a Poison-type Pokémon with gender differences. Sounds like a medication name.

name: Gengar
explanation: Gengar is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon that hides in shadows. Not a German engineering company.

name: Arcanine
explanation: Arcanine is a Fire-type legendary Pokémon known for its speed and loyalty. Not Arduino, the microcontroller.

name: Arduino
explanation: Arduino is an open-source electronics platform with easy-to-use hardware and software. Not the Fire-type Pokémon, that's Arcanine.

name: Nginx
explanation: Nginx is a popular web server and reverse proxy. Pronounced 'engine-x', looks like alien language.

name: Traefik
explanation: Traefik is a modern reverse proxy and load balancer. Sounds like a medication for traffic anxiety.

name: Cilium
explanation: Cilium is eBPF-based networking for Kubernetes. Named after cell biology, does network security.

name: Falco
explanation: Falco is a cloud-native runtime security tool. Named after a bird, catches threats.

name: Argo
explanation: Argo is a collection of Kubernetes-native workflow tools. Named after the mythical ship.

name: Seroquel
explanation: Seroquel (quetiapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar depression.

name: Latuda
explanation: Latuda (lurasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic for bipolar depression. Sounds like Latias/Latios!

name: Vraylar
explanation: Vraylar (cariprazine) is an atypical antipsychotic for bipolar disorder and depression.

name: Rexulti
explanation: Rexulti (brexpiprazole) is used to augment antidepressants. Sounds like a Pokémon evolution.

name: Viibryd
explanation: Viibryd (vilazodone) is an SSRI antidepressant with partial 5-HT1A agonist activity.

name: Gastly
explanation: Gastly is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon made of gas. Sounds like a stomach medication.

name: Koffing
explanation: Koffing is a Poison-type Pokémon that emits toxic gas. Sounds like a cough medicine.

name: Weezing
explanation: Weezing is Koffing's evolution. Really sounds like it should be a respiratory medication.

name: Tangela
explanation: Tangela is a Grass-type Pokémon covered in vines. Sounds like a hair product.

name: Nidoking
explanation: Nidoking is the final evolution of male Nidoran. Sounds like it could be a pharma company.

name: Starmie
explanation: Starmie is a Water/Psychic-type starfish Pokémon with a jewel core. Sounds like a kids' vitamin brand.

name: Dratini
explanation: Dratini is a Dragon-type Pokémon that was thought to be mythical. Sounds like a pasta or medication.

name: Dragonite
explanation: Dragonite is Dratini's final evolution. Sounds like a mineral supplement.

name: Orcrist
explanation: Orcrist is Thorin Oakenshield's Elven sword, the 'Goblin-cleaver', found with Glamdring.

name: Narsil
explanation: Narsil was the sword that cut the Ring from Sauron's hand, later reforged as Andúril.

name: Lothlórien
explanation: Lothlórien is the golden forest realm of Galadriel and Celeborn.

name: Rivendell
explanation: Rivendell (Imladris) is Elrond's hidden valley sanctuary, the 'Last Homely House'.

name: Mirkwood
explanation: Mirkwood is the great forest corrupted by Sauron's influence, home to Wood-elves and giant spiders.

name: Mordor
explanation: Mordor is Sauron's realm of shadow, where Mount Doom lies and the Ring was forged.

name: Isengard
explanation: Isengard is Saruman's fortress with the tower Orthanc, destroyed by the Ents.

name: Kibana
explanation: Kibana is a data visualization dashboard for Elasticsearch. Sounds like a Pokémon.

name: Elasticsearch
explanation: Elasticsearch is a distributed search and analytics engine.

name: Pulumi
explanation: Pulumi is an infrastructure-as-code tool. Sounds like a flower or Italian pasta.

name: Celeborn
explanation: Celeborn is Galadriel's husband and Lord of Lothlórien. Sounds like Celebi but much older.

name: Thranduil
explanation: Thranduil is Legolas's father and King of the Woodland Realm in Mirkwood.

name: Denethor
explanation: Denethor II was the Steward of Gondor who went mad and tried to burn Faramir.

name: Glorfindel
explanation: Glorfindel is a mighty Elf-lord who helped Frodo escape the Nazgûl to Rivendell.

name: Théoden
explanation: Théoden was the King of Rohan who led the charge at Pelennor Fields.

name: Éomer
explanation: Éomer is Éowyn's brother, Marshal of the Riddermark, who became King of Rohan.

name: Odin
explanation: Odin is the Norse Allfather, god of wisdom, war, and death. Gave up an eye for knowledge.

name: Thor
explanation: Thor is the Norse god of thunder who wields Mjölnir. Yes, before Marvel.

name: Freya
explanation: Freya is the Norse goddess of love, beauty, and war. Rides a chariot pulled by cats.

name: Tyr
explanation: Týr is the Norse god of war who lost his hand to Fenrir, AND a Faroese folk metal band!

name: Baldur
explanation: Baldur is the Norse god of light and purity, killed by mistletoe thanks to Loki's trickery.

name: Heimdall
explanation: Heimdall is the Norse guardian of Bifröst who can see and hear everything.

name: Frigg
explanation: Frigg is Odin's wife and Norse goddess of marriage and motherhood.

name: Hel
explanation: Hel is the Norse goddess of the underworld, daughter of Loki. Half alive, half dead.

name: Fenrir
explanation: Fenrir is the monstrous Norse wolf destined to kill Odin at Ragnarök.

name: Zeus
explanation: Zeus is the Greek king of gods, ruler of Mount Olympus and god of thunder.

name: Apollo
explanation: Apollo is the Greek god of sun, music, and prophecy, AND Apollo GraphQL is a popular API platform!

name: Athena
explanation: Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare, born from Zeus's head.

name: Poseidon
explanation: Poseidon is the Greek god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses.

name: Hades
explanation: Hades is the Greek god of the underworld and the dead. Not actually evil, just got a bad job.

name: Ares
explanation: Ares is the Greek god of war, known for being brutal and unpopular among other gods.

name: Hermes
explanation: Hermes is the Greek messenger god, also god of thieves, travelers, and commerce.

name: Artemis
explanation: Artemis is the Greek goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and the moon.

name: Aphrodite
explanation: Aphrodite is the Greek goddess of love and beauty, born from sea foam.

name: Dionysus
explanation: Dionysus is the Greek god of wine, festivity, and ecstasy. Life of the party.

name: Atlas
explanation: Atlas is the Greek Titan condemned to hold up the sky, AND MongoDB Atlas is a cloud database platform!

name: Cassandra
explanation: Cassandra was a Greek prophetess cursed to never be believed, AND Apache Cassandra is a distributed database!

name: Pandora
explanation: Pandora opened the box releasing all evils in Greek myth, AND Pandora is a music streaming service!

name: Jupiter
explanation: Jupiter is the Roman king of gods, equivalent to Zeus. Also a planet, but not a category.

name: Mars
explanation: Mars is the Roman god of war, much more respected than Greek Ares.

name: Venus
explanation: Venus is the Roman goddess of love, equivalent to Aphrodite.

name: Neptune
explanation: Neptune is the Roman god of the sea, equivalent to Poseidon.

name: Mercury
explanation: Mercury is the Roman messenger god, equivalent to Hermes. Also an element and planet.

name: Vulcan
explanation: Vulcan is the Roman god of fire and forge, equivalent to Hephaestus.

name: Minerva
explanation: Minerva is the Roman goddess of wisdom, equivalent to Athena.

name: Juno
explanation: Juno is the Roman queen of gods, AND Juno is an email security company!

name: Ceres
explanation: Ceres is the Roman goddess of agriculture and harvest.

name: Pluto
explanation: Pluto is the Roman god of the underworld, equivalent to Hades.

name: Morrigan
explanation: The Morrígan is the Celtic goddess of war, fate, and death, often appearing as a crow.

name: Brigid
explanation: Brigid is the Celtic goddess of fire, poetry, and smithcraft.

name: Cernunnos
explanation: Cernunnos is the Celtic horned god of nature, animals, and fertility.

name: Danu
explanation: Danu is the Celtic mother goddess, ancestor of the Tuatha Dé Danann.

name: Lugh
explanation: Lugh is the Celtic god of skill, crafts, and many talents.

name: Dagda
explanation: The Dagda is the Celtic father god with a magic club and cauldron of plenty.

name: Epona
explanation: Epona is the Celtic goddess of horses, adopted by the Romans.

name: Mastodon
explanation: Mastodon is an American progressive metal band, AND the decentralized social media platform! Double whammy.

name: Gojira
explanation: Gojira is a French progressive metal band. Sounds like Godzilla (it is), not a Pokémon.

name: Opeth
explanation: Opeth is a Swedish progressive metal/rock band. Sounds like it could be a medication.

name: Meshuggah
explanation: Meshuggah is a Swedish extreme metal band. Yiddish for 'crazy', not a Pokémon.

name: Amon Amarth
explanation: Amon Amarth is a Swedish melodic death metal band named after Mount Doom's Sindarin name in LOTR!

name: Gorgoroth
explanation: Gorgoroth is a Norwegian black metal band named after the plateau in Mordor from LOTR!

name: Burzum
explanation: Burzum was a Norwegian black metal project. The name is Black Speech for 'darkness' from LOTR!

name: Venom
explanation: Venom is an English extreme metal band, pioneers of black metal. Sounds like a Pokémon type.

name: Behemoth
explanation: Behemoth is a Polish blackened death metal band named after the biblical monster.

name: Nile
explanation: Nile is an American death metal band with Egyptian themes. Also a river, obviously.

name: Carcass
explanation: Carcass is an English extreme metal band, pioneers of grindcore.

name: Sepultura
explanation: Sepultura is a Brazilian metal band. The name is Portuguese for 'grave'.

name: Testament
explanation: Testament is an American thrash metal band from the Bay Area.

name: Exodus
explanation: Exodus is an American thrash metal band, one of the Big Four of Bay Area thrash.

name: Overkill
explanation: Overkill is an American thrash metal band from New Jersey.

name: Death
explanation: Death was an American death metal band, pioneers of the genre. Yes, just 'Death'.

name: Emperor
explanation: Emperor was a Norwegian black metal band known for symphonic elements.

name: Immortal
explanation: Immortal is a Norwegian black metal band famous for their 'Blashyrkh' mythology.

name: Mayhem
explanation: Mayhem is a Norwegian black metal band with an extremely controversial history.

name: Nightwish
explanation: Nightwish is a Finnish symphonic metal band. Sounds like a spell or medication.

name: Epica
explanation: Epica is a Dutch symphonic metal band. Sounds pharmaceutical, plays epic music.

name: Kamelot
explanation: Kamelot is an American power metal band. Sounds like Camelot, and that's intentional.

name: Sabaton
explanation: Sabaton is a Swedish power metal band focused on war history. Named after armored boots.

name: Eluveitie
explanation: Eluveitie is a Swiss folk metal band with Celtic influences. Good luck pronouncing it.

name: Ensiferum
explanation: Ensiferum is a Finnish folk metal band. Latin for 'sword-bearer'.

name: Rammstein
explanation: Rammstein is a German industrial metal band known for pyrotechnics.

name: Trivium
explanation: Trivium is an American heavy metal band. Named after the classical education trivium.

name: Baroness
explanation: Baroness is an American heavy metal band known for their colorful album artwork.

name: Sleep
explanation: Sleep is an American stoner/doom metal band. Sounds like a medication, makes heavy music.

name: Ghost
explanation: Ghost is a Swedish rock/metal band with Satanic imagery and catchy hooks.

name: Slayer
explanation: Slayer was an American thrash metal band, one of the Big Four of thrash.

name: Anthrax
explanation: Anthrax is an American thrash metal band, one of the Big Four. Yes, named after the disease.

name: Kreator
explanation: Kreator is a German thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Teutonic Four'.

name: Darkthrone
explanation: Darkthrone is a Norwegian black metal band, influential in the second wave.

name: Dimmu Borgir
explanation: Dimmu Borgir is a Norwegian symphonic black metal band. Named after an Icelandic lava formation.

name: Arch Enemy
explanation: Arch Enemy is a Swedish melodic death metal band.

name: Amorphis
explanation: Amorphis is a Finnish metal band with progressive and folk elements.

name: Insomnium
explanation: Insomnium is a Finnish melodic death metal band. Sounds like a sleep medication.

name: KALLAX
explanation: KALLAX is IKEA's popular cube shelving unit. Sounds like it could be a Norse god of organization.

name: MALM
explanation: MALM is IKEA's bed and dresser series. Swedish for 'ore', sounds like a Pokémon.

name: BILLY
explanation: BILLY is IKEA's iconic bookcase, sold since 1979. Just a regular name, but it's furniture.

name: POÄNG
explanation: POÄNG is IKEA's bentwood armchair. Swedish for 'point', sounds like a Pokémon move.

name: LACK
explanation: LACK is IKEA's simple side table series. Sounds like it's missing something.

name: HEMNES
explanation: HEMNES is IKEA's traditional furniture series. Named after a Norwegian municipality.

name: BESTÅ
explanation: BESTÅ is IKEA's storage system series. Sounds like 'best' in Swedish (it means 'to consist').

name: DETOLF
explanation: DETOLF is IKEA's glass display cabinet. Sounds like a Norse dwarf name.

name: EKTORP
explanation: EKTORP is IKEA's classic sofa series. Sounds like a spell or a Pokémon.

name: KLIPPAN
explanation: KLIPPAN is IKEA's compact sofa. Named after a Swedish town, sounds like a Pokémon.

name: FRAKTA
explanation: FRAKTA is IKEA's iconic blue bag. Swedish for 'to transport', sounds like a fracture medication.

name: BJÖRKUDDEN
explanation: BJÖRKUDDEN is an IKEA table series. Swedish for 'birch point', maximum Nordic energy.

name: RÅSKOG
explanation: RÅSKOG is IKEA's utility cart. Sounds like a Viking battle cry.

name: BEKVÄM
explanation: BEKVÄM is IKEA's step stool. Swedish for 'comfortable', sounds like a meditation app.

name: STRANDMON
explanation: STRANDMON is IKEA's wing chair. Sounds like a Pokémon evolution of 'Strandm'.

name: JÄRVFJÄLLET
explanation: JÄRVFJÄLLET is IKEA's office chair. Swedish for 'mountain of Järv', pronunciation nightmare.

name: MARKUS
explanation: MARKUS is IKEA's popular office chair. Just a regular name, but it's a chair.

name: KIVIK
explanation: KIVIK is IKEA's sofa series. Named after a Swedish town, sounds like a Pokémon.

name: SÖDERHAMN
explanation: SÖDERHAMN is IKEA's modular sofa. Named after a Swedish city, very Nordic.

name: VITTSJÖ
explanation: VITTSJÖ is IKEA's glass shelving unit. Swedish for 'white lake', sounds like a spell.

name: HAVSTA
explanation: HAVSTA is IKEA's storage series. Sounds like a Viking settlement.

name: IVAR
explanation: IVAR is IKEA's pine shelving system. A Nordic name, also 'Ivar the Boneless' was a Viking.

name: TROFAST
explanation: TROFAST is IKEA's kids storage. Swedish for 'faithful', sounds like a medication.

name: BRIMNES
explanation: BRIMNES is IKEA's bed/storage series. Sounds like a Lord of the Rings location.

name: NORDLI
explanation: NORDLI is IKEA's bedroom series. Very obviously Nordic, sounds like a medication.

name: FENOMEN
explanation: FENOMEN is IKEA's unscented candle. Swedish for 'phenomenon', sounds dramatic for a candle.

name: SKURUP
explanation: SKURUP is IKEA's lamp series. Named after a Swedish town, sounds like a startup.

name: TERTIAL
explanation: TERTIAL is IKEA's work lamp. Latin-sounding, like a medication or academic term.

name: GODMORGON
explanation: GODMORGON is IKEA's bathroom series. Swedish for 'good morning', surprisingly literal.

name: FLISAT
explanation: FLISAT is IKEA's children's series. Sounds like a medication for children.

name: ANTILOP
explanation: ANTILOP is IKEA's high chair. Swedish for 'antelope', which is a strange choice for a baby chair.

name: DUKTIG
explanation: DUKTIG is IKEA's play kitchen series. Swedish for 'clever/good', sounds like a medication.

name: Anakin
explanation: Anakin Skywalker is the Chosen One who became Darth Vader. Not an antidepressant.

name: Padmé
explanation: Padmé Amidala is the Queen/Senator of Naboo and Anakin's wife.

name: Qui-Gon
explanation: Qui-Gon Jinn is the Jedi who discovered Anakin. Sounds like a medication or martial art.

name: Obi-Wan
explanation: Obi-Wan Kenobi is the legendary Jedi Master who trained Anakin and Luke.

name: Yoda
explanation: Yoda is the 900-year-old Jedi Grand Master. Backwards, he speaks.

name: Mace Windu
explanation: Mace Windu is the purple lightsaber Jedi Master. Because Samuel L. Jackson wanted purple.

name: Palpatine
explanation: Palpatine is the Sith Lord who became Emperor. Sounds like a medication for heart palpitations.

name: Dooku
explanation: Count Dooku is the elegant Sith Lord played by Christopher Lee. Sounds like a Pokémon.

name: Grievous
explanation: General Grievous is the cyborg Separatist leader who collects lightsabers.

name: Kylo Ren
explanation: Kylo Ren is Ben Solo's dark side alter ego. Sounds like a tech startup.

name: Ahsoka
explanation: Ahsoka Tano is Anakin's former Padawan who left the Jedi Order.

name: Grogu
explanation: Grogu is 'Baby Yoda's real name from The Mandalorian. Sounds like a Pokémon.

name: Din Djarin
explanation: Din Djarin is The Mandalorian's real name. Sounds like a medication.

name: Thrawn
explanation: Grand Admiral Thrawn is the blue-skinned tactical genius from the Empire.

name: Tarkin
explanation: Grand Moff Tarkin commanded the Death Star. Sounds like a medication or tech company.

name: Jabba
explanation: Jabba the Hutt is the crime lord slug. Sounds like a JavaScript framework.

name: Boba Fett
explanation: Boba Fett is the legendary bounty hunter clone of Jango Fett.

name: Chewbacca
explanation: Chewbacca is Han Solo's Wookiee co-pilot and best friend.

name: Lando
explanation: Lando Calrissian is the smooth gambler and former Baron of Cloud City.

name: Tatooine
explanation: Tatooine is the desert planet with two suns where Luke grew up.

name: Coruscant
explanation: Coruscant is the city-covered capital planet of the Republic/Empire.

name: Naboo
explanation: Naboo is Padmé's lush homeworld with underwater Gungans.

name: Mustafar
explanation: Mustafar is the lava planet where Anakin became Vader. Sounds like a condiment.

name: Hoth
explanation: Hoth is the ice planet where the Rebels had Echo Base.

name: Dagobah
explanation: Dagobah is the swamp planet where Yoda lived in exile. Sounds like a medication.

name: Endor
explanation: Endor is the forest moon of Ewoks where Death Star II was destroyed.

name: Bespin
explanation: Bespin is the gas giant where Cloud City floats. Sounds like a medication.

name: Kashyyyk
explanation: Kashyyyk is the Wookiee homeworld. Good luck spelling it correctly.

name: Mandalore
explanation: Mandalore is the warrior planet of the Mandalorians.

name: Alderaan
explanation: Alderaan was Leia's peaceful homeworld. Was. Death Star happened.

name: Jakku
explanation: Jakku is the desert junkyard planet where Rey grew up. Sounds like a Pokémon.

name: Kyber
explanation: Kyber crystals power lightsabers. Sounds like cyber or a cryptocurrency.

name: Holocron
explanation: Holocrons are ancient data storage devices for Jedi/Sith knowledge. Sounds like a tech company.

name: Bacta
explanation: Bacta is the healing liquid used in tanks. Actually sounds like a medication!

name: Sarlacc
explanation: The Sarlacc is the pit monster that digests prey for 1000 years. Sounds like a medication.

name: Rancor
explanation: The Rancor is Jabba's pet monster. Also means 'bitter resentment'.

name: Ewok
explanation: Ewoks are the teddy bear warriors of Endor. Sounds like a Pokémon.

name: Wookiee
explanation: Wookiees are the tall furry species from Kashyyyk. Note the double 'e'.

name: Twi'lek
explanation: Twi'leks are the species with head-tails (lekku). Sounds like a tech startup.

name: Zabrak
explanation: Zabraks are the horned species like Darth Maul. Sounds like a medication.

name: Sith
explanation: The Sith are the dark side Force users. Not a lisp.

name: Jedi
explanation: The Jedi are the light side Force users and peacekeepers. Iconic.
